column4: hi, i currently have feisty and windows xp in dual boot, am i able to run my windows xp inside of feisty using qemu or something?
I currently have feisty and windows xp in dual boot, am i able to run my windows xp inside of feisty using qemu or something?
i would suggest to use vmplayer
i installed that, but i got the idea that i would need to re-install windows xp
nope
u should not need to i believe
when it opens all it asks me for is a .vmx file
i can browse my machine or quit
but reinstalling it in vmware has its advantages, first of all that u will have a clean new system of course
u can just bridge ur network connections
and they will work in the vmplayer as well
yes u need to create a vmx file
u can select in vmware to look for an windows install
it should create necessary files
tarelrulz: vmplayer is not a mediaplayer
umm, what does network connections have to do with this? lol, and i think il just keep my xp if i cant do it
it belongs to vmware
virtual manager
commercial OS emulator
but vmplayer is for free
do i need to install vmware server or something along with player?
